result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael F. Stovall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael F. Stovall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael F. Stovall was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Michael F. Stovall was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: TIME SERVED - concurrent with Ct. 1.  -  Costs waived

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael F. Stovall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Valerie Karls.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 3 and 4 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 2 - Pleas of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Def. sentenced to serve 134 days in Co. Jail on each count, concurrent.  Credit for 134 days served.  Costs waived.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney V Karls.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Karls acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  FPT 8/5/14 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Atty Zach Wittchow appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE. KPD Off. Greg Munnelly sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Karls. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 7-31-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney V Karls.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft does not oppose the court providing the jail w/a psychiatric copy of the report so that he can receive medications he is prescribed.  Atty Karls states she and deft are in agreement that he is competent to proceed.  Court finds deft competent to proceed.  Preliminary hearing set for 7/16/14 at 9:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty V Karls appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Val states the deft is at Mendota; received report that the deft is not competent but is likely to become competent; is still being treated.  CH continued to 9/10/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney V Karls.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Karls states they are in agreement w/the Dr's report.  Court finds that there is a competency issue; that deft is to go to Mendota for medication, that the deft is not competent to proceed; finds that the deft is likely to regain competence w/n a month.  CH continued to 6/3/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney V Karls.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Karls states she has not received a competency report however believes the deft is competent and withdraws the other attorneys requst for evaluation to be done.  Preliminary hearing set for 4/23/14 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

2:16 pm    Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Everett King.  Clerk; LE.  Deft waives his right to counsel.  Referred to Br. 6 for further disposition on 4-15-14 @ 8:15 am.  Competency Evaluation.  Deft does not want representation from SPD's office.  Atty King raises issue of competency.  Probable cause found in complaint.  Court orders competency evaluation under 971.14(2) to be performed by Milwaukee Forensic Unit; in custody report to be filed in 15 days.  Tempory bond set by court at $25000 cash.

Temporary Bond
946.41(1) Resisting, Repeater   /   946.49(1)(b) Felony BJ, Repeater  3 cts
and witness list filed by the State
